artist: Artist: Sebald Beham; Artist: After Barthel Beham
creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: three nude women standing close together, with skeleton at back addressing R female figure; one woman stands with her back fully to the viewer with her foot on a death's head and her arm around an older, emaciated woman to her PL
inscription:
Signature

-- in graphite on verso: Beham | APG 5801 | RCXW | B151 | 1er etat | VCG1 | rslol[?] 
-- in brown pen on verso: SB8[?]
-- in graphite on mat: [on loan outside museum L87.111.1&2]
provenance: Paul Prouté, Paris; [C. & J. Goodfriend, New York, until November 26, 1985; sold to Andrus]; John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
title: Death and the Three Nude Women
